full_text: Welcome to the configuring permissions demonstration. Succeed Insurance has identified a requirement to limit which employees are able to add and remove officials on a claim. Initially, this will be permitted only to adjusters. I begin by typing Alt Shift I to determine the name of the PCF that contains the Add slash Remove Officials buttons. It is the Lost Details detail view. The first step is to add a new permission type. The system permission type type list already has an extension I can use. I click to add. And name the new permission official manage, remembering to use the underscore SI suffix. The name is Add and Remove Officials.  And add a description.  And add a description. The next step is to set the visibility properties on the toolbar on Lost Details. I will use the auto mode of the detail view. In a real implementation I would probably also need to do the same for other modes, but for this demonstration I will keep it simple. I scroll down and select the button set for the officials list. There are two visibility properties on this toolbar, one for the Add button. And one for the Remove button. I'll populate them both with the system permission I just created. Now I'll restart the server so my changes will be effective in the application. When the server is ready. I'll add the new permission to the adjuster role. On the roles page of the administration tab. I click the adjuster role. And edit it. I click Add. And select my new permission. To test the configuration, I will log in as two users, an adjuster and a supervisor. And the Applegate is the adjuster I'll use. I'll navigate to a claim. On the Lost Details page. I click Edit. The Add and Remove buttons are visible to the adjuster. Remove is not currently available because there is nothing selected to remove. Now I'll log in as Sue Smith, a claims supervisor. I'll navigate to the same claim. I'll navigate to the same claim. And the Lost Details screen. When I click Edit. The Add and Remove buttons are not visible. It'

segments.text: Welcome to the configuring permissions demonstration.
Succeed Insurance has identified a requirement to limit which employees are able to add and remove officials on a claim. Initially, this will be permitted only to adjusters.
I begin by typing Alt Shift I to determine the name of the PCF that contains the Add slash Remove Officials buttons.
It is the Lost Details detail view.
The first step is to add a new permission type.
The system permission type type list already has an extension I can use.
I click to add.
And name the new permission official manage, remembering to use the underscore SI suffix.
The name is Add and Remove Officials.
And add a description.
And add a description.
The next step is to set the visibility properties on the toolbar on Lost Details.
I will use the auto mode of the detail view.
In a real implementation I would probably also need to do the same for other modes, but for this demonstration I will keep it simple.
I scroll down and select the button set for the officials list.
There are two visibility properties on this toolbar, one for the Add button.
And one for the Remove button.
I'll populate them both with the system permission I just created.
Now I'll restart the server so my changes will be effective in the application.
When the server is ready.
I'll add the new permission to the adjuster role.
On the roles page of the administration tab.
I click the adjuster role.
And edit it.
I click Add.
And select my new permission.
To test the configuration, I will log in as two users, an adjuster and a supervisor.
And the Applegate is the adjuster I'll use.
I'll navigate to a claim.
On the Lost Details page.
I click Edit.
The Add and Remove buttons are visible to the adjuster.
Remove is not currently available because there is nothing selected to remove.
Now I'll log in as Sue Smith, a claims supervisor.
I'll navigate to the same claim.
I'll navigate to the same claim.
And the Lost Details screen.
When I click Edit.
The Add and Remove buttons are not visible.

It'
